result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.

10:33 AM Defendant Maquan D McAllister in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Defense requests adjournment.  SPD has not appointed.  Deft. submits a motion to dismiss.  BTC: Motion to dismiss denied.  Defendant has tried to hire 4 attorneys.  Deft. called atty Hall, Cafferty and Chapman.  Deft. has not hired any of these attorneys.  Deft. wishes to go forward with an atty.  BTC: County atty appointed at a repayment of $10/month beginning in 90 days.  Deft. asks for a change of venue.  BTC: Court will not address this today.  
BTC: Matter adjourned. Finding of good cause to waive time limits.

State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
State's NOI  Drug Expert

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maquan D McAllister appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Maquan D McAllister. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
